docs.lead_paragraph: While female voters generally tend to favor President Obama, that cannot be said of white women without college degrees, a subset known — in this race — as waitress moms.

headline.seo: Female Swing Voters, a Coveted Demographic
headline.main: Crucial Subset: Female Voters Still Deciding
headline.print_headline: Crucial Subset: Female Voters Still Deciding

docs.abstract: Subset of women voters in 2012 presidential election represent coveted swing votes, undecided between Pres Obama, who they say has not lived up to expectations, and Mitt Romney, who they fear could set women back because he does not understand their needs; intense competition for female voters, especially blue-collar white women who did not attend college, is underscored in remarks made by both candidates throughout the campaign.
docs.snippet: While female voters generally tend to favor President Obama, that cannot be said of white women without college degrees, a subset known — in this race — as waitress moms.

docs.lead_paragraph: The advice, for women in their third trimester, follows a resurgence of the disease and is only the second time a vaccine has been advised for all women during pregnancy.

headline.main: Whooping Cough Vaccine Urged for Pregnant Women
headline.print_headline: Whooping Cough Vaccine Urged For Pregnant Women

docs.abstract: Government’s vaccine advisory panel is urging every expectant mother to get whooping cough vaccine, preferably in last three months of pregnancy, following resurgence of the disease.
docs.snippet: The advice, for women in their third trimester, follows a resurgence of the disease and is only the second time a vaccine has been advised for all women during pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: A New Jersey case over whether a woman can be called the mother of the child she and her husband had through a surrogate shows the murkiness of  surrogacy laws in the United States.

headline.seo: In Surrogacy Case, Infertile Wife Loses Appeal to Be Named Legal Mother
headline.main: Court’s Split Decision Provides Little Clarity on Surrogacy
headline.print_headline: Court’s Split Helps Provide Little Clarity On Surrogacy

docs.abstract: New Jersey case over whether a woman can be called the mother of the child she and her husband had through a surrogate shows the murkiness of surrogacy laws in the United States; case comes 25 years after New Jersey was at the center of what remains the best-known surrogate custody dispute, over a child known as Baby M.
docs.snippet: A New Jersey case over whether a woman can be called the mother of the child she and her husband had through a surrogate shows the murkiness of  surrogacy laws in the United States.

docs.abstract: “Even if life begins in that horrible situation of rape,” the Senate candidate said, “that is something that God intended to happen.”
docs.snippet: “Even if life begins in that horrible situation of rape,” the Senate candidate said, “that is something that God intended to happen.”

docs.lead_paragraph: Members of the Conservative government have ignited a largely dormant debate in Britain by saying they favor reducing abortion term limits, and the subject has now become a political flash point.

headline.main: British Conservatives Play the Abortion Card
headline.print_headline: British Conservatives Play the Abortion Card

docs.snippet: Members of the Conservative government have ignited a largely dormant debate in Britain by saying they favor reducing abortion term limits, and the subject has now become a political flash point.

headline.main: An Unspoken Risk of Vaginal Birth

docs.abstract: When what you remember most about the day your child was born is not her or his cute nose, but the way your body was ripped apart, it can be hard to admit.
docs.snippet: When what you remember most about the day your child was born is not her or his cute nose, but the way your body was ripped apart, it can be hard to admit.

headline.main: The Family Doctor, Minus the M.D.

docs.abstract: America has a serious shortage of primary care physicians. But Family Health Clinic in Delphi, Ind., is a model of how nurses can help fill the gap.
docs.snippet: America has a serious shortage of primary care physicians. But Family Health Clinic in Delphi, Ind., is a model of how nurses can help fill the gap.

docs.lead_paragraph: OB-GYNs need to let women know that freezing their eggs is an option in family planning.

headline.main: We Need to Talk About Our Eggs
headline.print_headline: We Need to Talk About Our Eggs

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Sarah Elizabeth Richards contends that obstetrician-gynecologists should discuss fertility and family planning with women in their annual exams; asserts that such discussions could lead to women knowing more about freezing their eggs, which would preserve their ability to have children well into their 40s.
docs.snippet: OB-GYNs need to let women know that freezing their eggs is an option in family planning.

docs.lead_paragraph: Progesterone has been found useful in preventing preterm births among some women, but in those with a cervix shorter than 30 millimeters, injections of the hormone were found to have no benefit.

headline.seo: Limits to Progesterone in Reducing Risk of Preterm Birth
headline.main: Limits of Progesterone in Curbing Early Birth
headline.print_headline: Limits of Progesterone In Curbing Early Birth

docs.abstract: Dr William A Grobman study in The American Journal of Obstetrics & Gynecology finds that progesterone, which has been found effective in preventing preterm births among women with a cervical length of less than 20 millimeters, does not work for women with a cervix shorter than 30 millimeters.
docs.snippet: Progesterone has been found useful in preventing preterm births among some women, but in those with a cervix shorter than 30 millimeters, injections of the hormone were found to have no benefit.

docs.lead_paragraph: John Jiler’s play, much like his life, focuses on the conflicts and confusion of a baby boomer’s relationships with his father and his son.

headline.seo: Boomer Finds Drama in His Situation

docs.snippet: John Jiler’s play, much like his life, focuses on the conflicts and confusion of a baby boomer’s relationships with his father and his son.
